greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of b(-q)^2 in powers of q where b() is a cubic AGM theta function.
comment: Cubic AGM theta functions: a(q) (see A004016), b(q) (A005928), c(q) (A005882).
Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of f(q)^6 / f(q^3)^2 in powers of q where f() is a Ramanujan theta function.
Expansion of (eta(q^2)^9 * eta(q^3) * eta(q^12) / (eta(q)^3 * eta(q^4)^3 * eta(q^6)^3))^2 in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (36 t)) = 972 (t/i)^2 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A134079.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ -q]^6 / QPochhammer[ -q^3]^2, {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x^2 + A)^9 * eta(x^3 + A) * eta(x^12 + A) / (eta(x + A)^3 * eta(x^4 + A)^3 * eta(x^6 + A)^3))^2, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 27 2015
